title: Module 1: Add circuit breaker and parallel fallback for API calls
description: Module 1 has tech debt: No circuit breaker - if all APIs fail, requests continue trying. Need to implement circuit breaker pattern and make fallback chain parallel instead of sequential for better performance.
design: Add circuit breaker to stop trying APIs after consecutive failures. Parallelize API calls with Promise.all for fallbacks. Add monitoring metrics for API success/failure rates per source.
notes: Module 1: Stock Data API - Complexity 7/10. Issue: 72. No Circuit Breaker, 73. No Monitoring, 74. Hardcoded Priorities
close_reason: Redundant - modules 1, 2, and 3 are already completed based on user feedback

title: Watchlist: Cannot search/add MELI stock
description: We can load MELI (MercadoLibre) in the metrics tab by entering the symbol directly, but we cannot search for it in the search bar or add it to watchlist through the search functionality. This appears to be a data availability issue in the search/indexed stocks list.
notes: Fixed by: 1) Adding popular non-S&P 500 stocks (MELI, COIN, SMCI, UBER, etc.) to stock_universe_seed.py fallback list; 2) Adding manual symbol entry fallback in WatchlistManager.js for symbols not found in database
close_reason: Fixed by: 1) Adding popular non-S&P 500 stocks (MELI, COIN, SMCI, UBER, etc.) to stock_universe_seed.py fallback list; 2) Adding manual symbol entry fallback in WatchlistManager.js for symbols not found in database

title: Module 5: Add error boundaries and module lifecycle management
description: Module 5 has tech debt: No error boundaries - one module error can crash entire app. No module lifecycle - no cleanup on tab switch. Need to implement proper error handling and lifecycle management to prevent crashes and memory leaks.

notes: CloudFormation template or manual schema update script

title: Test: API endpoint tests for stock universe
description:
Create comprehensive API endpoint tests for stock universe functionality:

Test coverage should include:

**GET Endpoints:**
- GET /api/stocks/search?q={query} - Search functionality
- GET /api/stocks/popular - Popular stocks endpoint
- GET /api/stocks/sectors - List all sectors
- GET /api/stocks/filter?sector={sector} - Filter by sector
- GET /api/stocks/symbol/{symbol} - Get specific stock details

**POST/PUT Endpoints:**
- POST /api/stocks (if exists) - Create stock entry
- PUT /api/stocks/{symbol} - Update stock data

**Error Scenarios:**
- Invalid symbol format (400 Bad Request)
- Symbol not found (404 Not Found)
- Missing required parameters
- Malformed JSON payloads
- Rate limiting responses (429)

**Response Validation:**
- JSON schema validation
- Required fields presence
- Data type validation
- CORS headers verification

Files to test:
- infrastructure/backend/stock_universe_api.py
- infrastructure/backend/lambda_handler.py (routing)

Acceptance Criteria:
- All endpoints tested with valid and invalid inputs
- Response schemas validated
- Error codes match specification
- Tests can run against local server or deployed API
- Include performance benchmarks (response time < 500ms)
close_reason: Completed API endpoint tests for stock universe with 24 test cases. All 153 tests passing.

title: Module 3: Enhance Watchlist with conflict resolution and advanced features
description: Module 3 has tech debt: No conflict resolution for concurrent updates, limited alert features (only in-app, no email/SMS), no bulk import from external sources, no performance tracking/analytics, simple validation (only basic symbol). Need to add proper sync resolution, external notification channels, import capabilities, and analytics.
notes: Module 3: Watchlist Management - Complexity 6/10. Issues: 97. No Conflict Resolution, 98. Limited Alert Features, 99. No Bulk Import, 100. No Performance Tracking, 101. Simple Validation

title: Test: End-to-end stock universe seeding workflow
description:
Create end-to-end tests for the complete stock universe seeding workflow:

Test coverage should include:

**Full Workflow:**
1. Trigger seeding process (manual or scheduled)
2. Fetch data from all index sources:
   - SP500 from Wikipedia
   - Russell 3000 from FTSE Russell
   - JSE from JSE website
3. Validate and merge data from multiple sources
4. Enrich with Yahoo Finance data (price, metrics)
5. Transform and normalize data
6. Write to DynamoDB stock-universe table
7. Verify data integrity in database

**Integration Points:**
- EventBridge trigger simulation
- Circuit breaker behavior during seeding
- API client fallback mechanism
- Database write operations
- Cache management

**Error Handling:**
- Partial failures (one index source down)
- Complete seeding failure recovery
- Data validation failures
- Database throttling scenarios
- Circuit breaker open states

**Performance:**
- Seeding duration benchmarks
- Memory usage monitoring
- API call quotas/limiting
- Concurrent fetch handling

**Validation:**
- Data completeness (all symbols present)
- Data accuracy (cross-reference with sources)
- Duplicate detection and handling
- Sector/market cap bucket assignment

Files to test:
- infrastructure/backend/stock_universe_seed.py
- infrastructure/backend/index_fetchers/*
- infrastructure/backend/stock_validator.py
- infrastructure/template.yaml (EventBridge schedule)

Acceptance Criteria:
- Full seeding workflow completes successfully
- Partial failures handled gracefully
- Data integrity validated post-seeding
- Performance within acceptable limits (< 10 minutes for full seed)
- Idempotent (re-running produces same results)
- Can run in isolated test environment
close_reason: Completed E2E tests for stock universe seeding workflow with 17 test cases. All 170 tests passing.

title: Module 4: Multi-index support with automated data updates and validation
description: Implement multi-index stock universe supporting S&P 500, Russell 3000, and JSE All Share indices. Add automated updates, FX conversion for ZAR stocks, per-region validation, and data quality monitoring. See docs/MULTI_INDEX_ARCHITECTURE.md for complete design.
design: Architecture: 1) Index config registry with metadata per index; 2) Strategy pattern for index fetchers (base class + SP500/Russell/JSE implementations); 3) DynamoDB schema enhancements (region, currency, indexId fields, GSIs); 4) FX rate conversion for ZAR→USD; 5) Per-region validation rules; 6) Enhanced API with region/index/currency filters; 7) Multiple EventBridge schedules per index
close_reason: Module 4 complete: Implemented multi-index stock universe supporting S&P 500, Russell 3000, and JSE All Share indices. Includes: 1) IndexConfig registry with metadata; 2) Fetcher strategy pattern (SP500Fetcher, Russell3000Fetcher, JSEFetcher); 3) Refactored StockUniverseSeeder with seed_index/seed_all_indices/_merge_index_memberships; 4) StockValidator module for data quality checks; 5) StockUniverseMetrics module for CloudWatch tracking; 6) CloudFormation template with 4 new GSIs and 4 staggered EventBridge schedules; 7) Multi-index API endpoints (/indices, /indices/{id}, /indices/{id}/stocks) with region/indexId/currency filtering

title: Test: Integration tests for multi-index DynamoDB schema
description:
Create integration tests for the multi-index DynamoDB schema changes:

Test coverage should include:
- Table structure validation (stock-universe table)
- Global Secondary Index (GSI) testing:
  - sector-index GSI queries
  - marketcap-index GSI queries
  - index-membership GSI queries
- Data insertion with proper partition/sort keys
- Query patterns for:
  - Get stocks by index (e.g., all SP500 stocks)
  - Filter by sector
  - Filter by market cap bucket
  - Search by symbol
- Batch operations (batch_get_item, batch_write_item)
- TTL (Time To Live) functionality
- Schema migration validation

Files to test:
- infrastructure/template.yaml (DynamoDB resources)
- infrastructure/backend/stock_universe_api.py (DB operations)
- infrastructure/backend/stock_universe_seed.py (DB writes)

Acceptance Criteria:
- Tests use local DynamoDB or test tables
- All GSI query patterns validated
- Batch operations tested with various sizes
- Error scenarios covered (throttling, validation)
- Minimum 75% coverage on DB operations
close_reason: Completed integration tests for DynamoDB multi-index schema with 22 test cases. All tests passing.
